description: This tests the mapping from previous version variable names to new ones in csv
title: CSV data dictionary version update

fields.name: BRTHDTC
fields.title: Birth date
fields.description: Date (and time, if applicable and known) the participant/subject was born.

fields.name: Age
fields.title: Age
fields.description: Value for participant/subject's age, calculated as elapsed time since the birth of the participant/subject.

fields.name: Sex
fields.title: Sex birth type
fields.description: Self-reported sex at birth of the participant/subject. The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.

enumLabels.1: Male, A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces sperm. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, cultural gender role distinctions, or both
enumLabels.2: Female, A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both
enumLabels.3: Unknown, Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused
enumLabels.4: Intersex, A person (one of unisexual specimens) who is born with genitalia and/or secondary sexual characteristics of indeterminate sex, or which combine features of both sexes

fields.name: GENIDENT
fields.title: Gender identification type
fields.description: Self-reported participant's/subject's internally held sense of their gender, which may or may not correspond to the individual's genotypic or phenotypic sex.

fields.name: GENIDENTOTH
fields.title: Gender identification other type text
fields.description: The free-text field related to 'Gender idenitification type.

fields.name: ETHNIC
fields.title: Ethnicity category
fields.description: Category of ethnicity the participant/subject most closely identifies with. A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease

enumLabels.1: Hispanic or Latino, A person of Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban, Central or South American or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race
enumLabels.2: Not Hispanic or Latino, A person not of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race. An arbitrary ethnic classification
enumLabels.3: Unknown, Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused
enumLabels.4: Not reported, Not provided or available
